snippet: Deadly Israeli airstrikes and persistent Palestinian rocket attacks indicate the two sides are set on a course of further escalation.
abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu says his forces are fighting Hamas to quell its rocket barrages from Gaza, ignoring outside criticism, and calls for restraint in increasingly deadly aerial assaults; Palestinian militants fire salvos into central and southern Israel and say their arsenal has barely been dented.

byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and FARES AKRAM
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and Fares Akram from Gaza. Rick Gladstone and Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from New York, and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Deadly Israeli airstrikes and persistent Palestinian rocket attacks indicate the two sides are set on a course of further escalation.

headline.main: Israeli Leader Calls for ‘Full Force’ in Effort to Quell Hamas Rocket Attacks
headline.print_headline: Israeli Leader Calls for ‘Full Force’ in Effort to Quell Hamas Rocket Attacks
